questions.question: The substance that is produced from a chemical reaction
The substances mixed together to start a chemical reaction
What can increase or decrease in a chemical reaction?
What is a solid substance that forms and separates from a solution?
When vinegar and baking soda are combined, bubbles form. What is this evidence of?
When you combine two reactants, the product might change to a different ____ such as blue to red.
A glow stick is an example of which sign of a chemical reaction?
Which of the following provides the best evidence that a chemical reaction took place?

choices.answer: water, when boiled evaportaes and turns to vapor
sugar dissolves completely when added to water
a liquid becomes a solid when heat is removed
Two liquids are mixed and a solid substance forms.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best description of the results of a chemical reaction?

choices.answer: A new substance with different properties is formed.
The substances seem to disappear after dissolving in water
The substance goes from liquid to solid at a low temp
The reaction reverses back to the orignial substance

questions.question: Two chemicals combine in a beaker and react.  What evidence shows absorbed and released heat?

choices.answer: The masses of the substances before and after the reaction
The temperature inside the beaker before and after
Whether or not light and sound were produced
How long it took for the reaction to take place

questions.question: In which of the following examples has a chemical reaction occurred?

choices.answer: After putting batter into a hot pan, the batter turns brown
Blending fruit in a blender, the fruits are mixed together
After a tray of ice is taken out of a freezer and melts
Adding sugar to coffee, the sugar dissolves

questions.question: Why does fruit change color and rot?

choices.answer: When exposed to hydrogen, the fruit changes properties
When exposed to sulfur, the fruit changes properties
When exposed to oxygen, the fruit changes properties
Fruit does not change color or rot

questions.question: In which experiment did a chemical reaction take place?

choices.answer: Two liquids combined=level of liquid increases
Crystals added to liquid=crystals dissolve completely
Solid added to liquid=solid sinks to bottom of container

questions.question: When chemical substances interact and are chemically changed, producing a new substance it is called a
In a chemical reaction, molecules stay the same and do NOT rearrange their atoms.
What symbol do chemical equations use to show "produce" instead of an equal sign?
In a chemical reaction, the reactants have different properties from the product.
